qas.question: Companies including Viacom and Mediaset have done what against youtube?
How much did Viacom want in damages in their lawsuit against youtube?
What does youtube do to prevent losing lawsuits involving copyright infringement?

answers.text: goes far beyond its legal obligations

qas.question: How many unauthorized clips did Viacom allegedly find on youtube that infringed its copyrights?

plausible_answers.text: Viacom, Mediaset, and the English Premier League

qas.question: What organizations has YouTube filed lawsuits against?
Who found that their content had been viewed "an astounding 1 billion times?"

context: Organizations including <b4_0>Viacom, Mediaset, and the English Premier League<b4_0/> have <a0_0>filed lawsuits<a0_0/> against YouTube, claiming that it has done too little to prevent the uploading of copyrighted material. <b5_0><b6_0>Viacom<b6_0/><b5_0/>, demanding <a1_0>$1 billion<a1_0/> in damages, said that it had found more than <a3_0>150,000<a3_0/> unauthorized clips of its material on YouTube that had been viewed "an astounding 1.5 billion times". YouTube responded by stating that it "<a2_0>goes far beyond its legal obligations<a2_0/> in assisting content owners to protect their works".
